item.title: Jim add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jim add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "Deja Vu All Over Again" -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Jim add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jim add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "One thing he discovered with a great deal of astonishment was that music held for him more then just pleasure. There was meat to it. The grouping of sounds, their forms in the air as they rang out and faded, said something comforting to him about the rule of Creation. What the music said was that there is a right way for things to be ordered so that life might not always be just tangle and drift, but have a shape, an aim. It was a powerful argument that life did not just happen." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Jim add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Jim add a quote by Jewel
item.description: "In the end only kindness matters." -- Jewel

item.title: Jim add a quote by Elvis Costello
item.description: "Writing about music is like dancing about architecture - it's really a stupid thing to want to do." -- Elvis Costello

item.title: Jim add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "There are only a few notes. Just variations on a theme." -- John Lennon

item.title: Jim add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jim add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Jim add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Jim add a quote by William Vollmann
item.description: "So he lent her books. After all, one of life's best pleasures is reading a book of perfect beauty; more pleasurable still is rereading that book; most pleasurable of all is lending it to the person one loves: Now she is reading or has just read the scene with the mirrors; she who is so lovely is drinking in that loveliness I've drunk." -- William Vollmann
